newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia may lose 12 mln T grain on lack of combines.
newsitem.headline: Russia may lose 12 mln T grain on lack of combines.

text.p: Russia could lose 12 million tonnes of grain this autumn because it does not have enough combines to bring in the harvest before it spoils, the country's leading farm equipment manufacturer said on Thursday.
Thirty percent of Russia's 227,000 combines were not in working order and were not being replaced, leading to big losses, Itar-Tass news agency quoted Rosselmash as saying.
Rosselmash said losses from grain crops not brought in on time had steadily increased during the 1990s, reaching 9.2 million tonnes in 1996 from 5.7 million in 1991.
Production of combines and tractors has fallen sharply, leaving no replacements for obsolete machines. Russia produced 112,000 tractors in 1985 but only 2,500 last year.
Russia is forecasting its third bad harvest in a row of around 70 million net tonnes.
